---
title: "customer_updated_event.json"
---

## High-level description
This JSON file represents a Stripe customer updated event. It contains detailed information about a customer update, including the customer's data, previous attributes, and event metadata.

## Symbols

### Root Object
#### Description
The root object represents a Stripe event of type "customer.updated".

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| id | string | Unique identifier for the event |
| object | string | Type of object, always "event" for Stripe events |
| api_version | string | The version of the Stripe API used for this event |
| created | integer | Unix timestamp of when the event was created |
| data | object | Contains the updated customer object and previous attributes |
| livemode | boolean | Indicates whether this event occurred in live mode or test mode |
| pending_webhooks | integer | Number of webhooks yet to be delivered successfully for this event |
| request | object | Information about the API request that triggered this event |
| type | string | The specific type of event, in this case "customer.updated" |

### data Object
#### Description
Contains the updated customer object and the previous attributes that were changed.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| object | object | The updated customer object |
| previous_attributes | object | The attributes that were changed in this update |

### data.object (Customer Object)
#### Description
Represents the updated Stripe customer with various attributes.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| id | string | Unique identifier for the customer |
| object | string | Type of object, always "customer" for customer objects |
| address | null | Customer's address (null in this case) |
| balance | integer | Current balance of the customer |
| created | integer | Unix timestamp of when the customer was created |
| currency | null | Customer's preferred currency (null in this case) |
| default_source | string | ID of the default payment source for the customer |
| delinquent | boolean | Whether the customer's account is delinquent |
| email | string | Customer's email address |
| invoice_prefix | string | Prefix for invoice numbers for this customer |
| invoice_settings | object | Settings for invoices for this customer |
| metadata | object | Additional metadata associated with the customer |
| name | string | Customer's name |
| tax_exempt | string | Customer's tax exemption status |

### data.previous_attributes Object
#### Description
Contains the attributes that were changed in this update event.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| invoice_settings | object | Previous invoice settings that were updated |

### request Object
#### Description
Contains information about the API request that triggered this event.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| id | string | Unique identifier for the request |
| idempotency_key | string | Idempotency key used in the request |

## Dependencies
This JSON file doesn't have direct dependencies, but it represents data from the Stripe API, which implies a dependency on the Stripe platform.

## Configuration
This file doesn't contain configuration options. It's a representation of event data from Stripe.

## API/Interface Reference
While this file doesn't define an API, it represents the structure of a webhook payload that Stripe would send to notify about a customer update event. Applications integrating with Stripe would need to handle this event structure in their webhook endpoints.

| Endpoint | Method | Request | Response | Description |
|:---------|:-------|:--------|:---------|:------------|
| N/A | POST | This JSON payload | N/A | Stripe sends this payload to the configured webhook URL when a customer is updated |
